content: The PFA format supports high-quality text rendering and control over character shapes, which are vital for printed documents and professional design work. Users can install the font files in the system Fonts folder on Windows or macOS, where programs, such as Adobe Illustrator and Adobe Photoshop, can access them.

description: A file with .pfa extension is a Printer Font ASCII version of Adobe’s Type 1 font and contains font’s glyph data. The file is in human readable format and can be opened in any text editor. PostScript interpreter can use this type of font as a whole for its working. Printer Font Binary (PFB) version of Adobe’s Type 1 font contains the same information. However, unline PFA, it is in binary file format and is not human readable. PFA files can be incorporated into the system by copying into the system’s Fonts folder.

A PFA file is an Adobe Type 1 font file that stores the outlines of characters in a font. It contains ASCII text that defines how each character in the font should appear when printed or displayed on a compatible device. PFA fonts are commonly used in desktop publishing, graphic design, and professional printing environments.

instructions: You can open PFA files with FontForge. To open a PFA file with FontForge, select File → Open.
